text:
I am working on a site search but is it possible to also search for a specefik hubdb?

Currently I use the url

/de/suche?term=&limit=6&language=de&type=SITE_PAGE&type=LANDING_PAGE&type=BLOG_POST&type=LISTING_PAGE

but I like to also search for a specific hubdb en get the results

Hi Team,
I want to know what filters I can use from the contact API as a query parameter to get a set of records.

Hi,

I have been reading into the API documentation, googled and also had a chat with chatGPT.

I need to add and remove submissions to/on a form.

Added is working great with POST to the submissions endpoint. But I can't find a you to remove/delete a submission afterwards.

Any ideas how this should be done?

Hi everyone,
I'm building a conversation screen within our product so that customers can view their tickets and communicate with the agent within them. It would be based on what we currently have in the customer portal.
However, looking at the API (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations>) ("Send a message to a thread.") I couldn't find a way to start a conversation/thread from scratch like this ticket details component does. It just responds to an existing conversation. I would like to know why this limitation exists, if it really exists, and if there is any other endpoint for this purpose that could help me?
Did anyone fetched all the chat conversations from the particular inbox ? using the rest api ? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations>

Happy Friday all, I was wondering if someone could help point me in the right direction. I have a Python script that pulls all the records from the Contacts Table. I have a similar script that pulls from the Deals Table. What I'm struggling with is how to associate the Deals to the Contacts. I have an association type set up but as I need the data outside of HubSpot and I'm using SQL to create a new data report, I need to know how to link the 2 data tables. I've looked over the Associations API but Im not trying to push data into HubSpot and cant find anything that helps. Appreciate any support or guidance. Thanks, Dan
Hey is it possible to create a new conversation/thread with the api?
Hey Matthew!  I can help with this.

Dan - when you are fetching all contacts or all deals, you will want to include associations in the request.  

The only way to join contacts and deals is to have the record ID or the associated object.

Hello everyone!

I’m the Product Manager for the Automation Extension team here at HubSpot. Our focus is on equipping developers with the tools they need to create, customize, and scale automation using our frameworks and APIs. Specifically, we manage the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|Custom Action API>, which enables the creation of custom actions.

We’re committed to enhancing your experience and improving our tools, and we need your input to do that! Please take a moment to share your feedback through <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSegfw484-sfPWfRPy5Msn0jvy5cx4-ZH60O0l0XpdtyJaE9Gw/viewform|this survey>. Feel free to forward it to anyone else who might have valuable insights.

Your feedback is crucial in helping us serve you better, and we truly appreciate your time and input.

Thank you! :orange_heart:

Hey all,
I am struggling to find out how to do something with the API.

I want to pull all the emails from a Deal Record.
The following properties are what I am looking to pull from Deal:
`hs_email_text`
`hs_email_subject`
``hs_email_from_email``
I would like to pass in a Deal ID then receive all the emails on that record with the above properties

Greetings <@U06TJ889WDS>. Good news. We have an entirely new API that solves for this use case and it's going to public beta soon.  "custom customer portals" are a good use case for it. e.g. sounds like you've built your own user interface inside your software product where you want to show your customers their tickets and let them have two way conversations against those tickets.

Hey team! I've got some build scripts that deploy JavaScript files (and other static assets) to the HubSpot CMS using the Node package `@HubSpot/api-client` . The build scripts use the `HubSpotClient.cms.sourceCode.contentApi.replace` function.
Regardless of which IP runs the build script, I get an error from Cloudflare saying that I've been blocked by them as a possible attacker. How can I get unblocked? We're using a Private Access Token (PAT) to authenticate. Thanks so much!
